title: 113_hr3202
content: The Act is titled the "Essential Transportation Worker Identification Credential Assessment Act" and includes a comprehensive security assessment of the Transportation Security Card Program. The Secretary of Homeland Security must provide a comprehensive assessment of the transportation security card program's effectiveness in enhancing security for regulated facilities and vessels within a year of the Act's enactment. The assessment will be conducted by a national laboratory or a maritime security university-based center with expertise in maritime security. The comprehensive assessment of the transportation security card program's effectiveness will be conducted by a national laboratory or maritime security university-based center. It will evaluate security risks, address deficiencies, and include a cost-benefit analysis. The Secretary must submit a corrective action plan within 60 days of submitting the assessment. The Secretary must submit a corrective action plan within 60 days of the assessment, including an implementation plan with benchmarks, programmatic reforms, and revisions to regulations. The plan will be considered in any rule making related to the transportation security card program. The Secretary must submit a corrective action plan within 60 days of the assessment, including an implementation plan with benchmarks, programmatic reforms, and revisions to regulations. The plan will be considered in any rule making related to the transportation security card program. The Comptroller General will review the plan's implementation of recommendations from national laboratories, maritime security centers, and previous Comptroller General recommendations, informing relevant committees. The Secretary of Homeland Security must submit a corrective action plan within 60 days of the assessment, including an implementation plan with benchmarks, programmatic reforms, and revisions to regulations. The plan will be considered in any rule making related to the transportation security card program. The Comptroller General will review the plan's implementation of recommendations from national laboratories, maritime security centers, and previous Comptroller General recommendations, informing relevant committees. The Secretary may not issue a final rule requiring the use of transportation security card readers until the Comptroller General informs specific committees about the plan's responsiveness to recommendations. The plan will be considered in any rule making related to the transportation security card program. The Comptroller General will review the plan's implementation of recommendations from national laboratories, maritime security centers, and previous Comptroller General recommendations, informing relevant committees. The Secretary may not issue a final rule requiring the use of transportation security card readers until specific committees are informed about the plan's responsiveness to recommendations. Additionally, the Secretary must issue an updated list of transportation security card readers compatible with active transportation security cards. The Comptroller General will report to relevant committees every six months on the implementation of the corrective action plan for Transportation Worker Identification Credential (TWIC)-Reader Requirements. No additional funds are authorized for this Act and its amendments, using existing amounts for implementation.
